definition: To wrap or wind something around an object, typically used when referring to the action of enclosing or covering an item with a material, such as cloth, paper, or string. It is commonly employed when bundling or securing objects together, often involving a twisting or coiling motion.

examples.german: Sie wickelt das Baby in eine Decke.
examples.english: She wraps the baby in a blanket.

examples.german: Er wickelt den Verband um die Wunde.
examples.english: He wraps the bandage around the wound.

examples.german: Wir wickeln den Faden um den Stift.
examples.english: We wind the thread around the pen.

examples.german: Die Schlange wickelt sich um den Baum.
examples.english: The snake coils around the tree.
